threat: The TLS protocol 1.2 and earlier can encrypt compressed data without properly obfuscating the length of the unencrypted data, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain plaintext content by observing length differences during a series of guesses in which a provided string potentially matches an unknown string in encrypted and compressed traffic.
special:
The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:
In general, a standard system update will make all the necessary changes.
